abstract: Shareholders should be willing to sell near an offer price rather than wait to see a merger close
snippet: Shareholders should be willing to sell near an offer price rather than wait to see a merger close
lead_paragraph: A spate of corporate deal remorse has left investors regretful, too. Abbott Laboratories on Wednesday cited “material adverse events” in a legal bid to end its $5.8 billion takeover of the medical test maker Alere. Similar tensions have arisen in mergers involving Yahoo, Williams and Cigna. They all help make the case for heightened shareholder skepticism.

headline.main: Investor’s Remorse Follows Buyer’s Remorse as Big Deals Fall Apart
